intro: Spigelia coelostylioides, commonly known as the Florida spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive waxy texture. Spigelia coelostylioides typically grows in moist, acidic soils in forested areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
